speaker: s02e08c01u002
line: Ross kissed me.

speaker: s02e08c01u003
line: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

speaker: s02e08c01u004
line: It was unbelievable!

speaker: s02e08c01u005
line: Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!

speaker: s02e08c01u006
line: Ok, all right. We want to hear everything. Monica, get the wine and unplug the phone. Rachel, does this end well or do we need to get tissues?

speaker: s02e08c01u007
line: Oh, it ended very well.

speaker: s02e08c01u008
line: Oh.

speaker: s02e08c01u009
line: Do not start without me. Do not start without me.

speaker: s02e08c01u010
line: Ok, all right, let's hear about the kiss. Was it like, was it like a soft brush against your lips? Or was it like a, you know, a "I gotta have you now" kind of thing?

speaker: s02e08c01u011
line: Well, at first it was really intense, you know. And then, oh, god, and then we just sort of sunk into it.

speaker: s02e08c01u012
line: Ok, so, ok, was he holding you? Or was his hand like on your back?

speaker: s02e08c01u013
line: No, actually first they started on my waist. And then, they slid up, and then, they were in my hair.

speaker: s02e08c01u014
line: Ohhhh.

speaker: s02e08c04u002
line: This is a nice resume. Nice, nice, nice. Muy impressivo.

speaker: s02e08c04u003
line: So, Mr. Rastatter, what exactly does this job entail? The ad wasn't too clear.

speaker: s02e08c04u004
line: Mockolate.

speaker: s02e08c04u005
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: s02e08c04u006
line: Mockolate. It's a completely synthetic chocolate substitute.

speaker: s02e08c04u007
line: Ohh.

speaker: s02e08c04u008
line: Go ahead. Try a piece. Yeah, we think that Mockolate is even better than chocolate.

speaker: s02e08c04u009
line: All right. Mmm-mmm.

speaker: s02e08c04u010
line: Yeah?

speaker: s02e08c04u011
line: I love how it crumbles. Now see, your chocolate doesn't do that.

speaker: s02e08c04u012
line: No, ma'am. Well, anyhoo, we should be getting our F.D.A. approval any day now, hopefully, in time for Thanksgiving. See, the way we look at it, chocolate already dominates most of your major food-preparation holidays: Easter, Christmas, what have you.

speaker: s02e08c04u013
line: Mmm-mmm.

speaker: s02e08c04u014
line: But, we're thinking, given the right marketing, we can make Thanksgiving the Mockolate holiday.

speaker: s02e08c04u015
line: Wow.

speaker: s02e08c04u016
line: Aren't you going to swallow that?

speaker: s02e08c04u017
line: Just waiting for it to stop bubbling.

speaker: s02e08c04u018
line: Yeah, isn't that great?

speaker: s02e08c04u019
line: Mmm.

speaker: s02e08c04u020
line: Well, anyhoo, um, we are looking for a couple of chefs who can create some Thanksgiving-themed recipes. You think you might be interested?

speaker: s02e08c04u021
line: Abso... ...lutely. See, I love creating new recipes. I love Thanksgiving. And, well, now, I love Mockolate.

speaker: s02e08c04u022
line: Really?

speaker: s02e08c04u023
line: Especially the after taste, you know, I'll tell ya, that'll last ya till Christmas.

speaker: s02e08c05u002
line: How about Mockolate mousse?

speaker: s02e08c05u003
line: It's not, it's not very Thanksgiving-y.

speaker: s02e08c05u004
line: Ok, how about pilgrim Mockolate mousse?

speaker: s02e08c05u005
line: What makes it pilgrim?

speaker: s02e08c05u006
line: We'll put buckles on it.

speaker: s02e08c05u007
line: Hey.

speaker: s02e08c05u008
line: Hey.

speaker: s02e08c05u009
line: Hey.

speaker: s02e08c05u010
line: Did uh, Ross call?

speaker: s02e08c05u011
line: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: s02e08c05u012
line: Why didn't he call? He's gonna stay with Julie, isn't he? He's gonna stay with her and she's going to be all, "Hi, I'm Julie, Ross picked me, and we're gonna to get married, have a lot of kids and dig up stuff together."

speaker: s02e08c05u013
line: No offense, but that sounds nothing like her.

speaker: s02e08c06u002
line: I don't know what to do. What am I gonna do? I mean, this, this is like a complete nightmare.

speaker: s02e08c06u003
line: Oh, I know. This must be so hard. Oh, no. Two women love me. They're both gorgeous and sexy. My wallet's too small for my fifties, and my diamond shoes are too tight.

speaker: s02e08c06u004
line: Hey, here's a thought, Ross.

speaker: s02e08c06u005
line: Don't touch the computer. Don't ever touch the computer.

speaker: s02e08c06u006
line: Ross, listen. I got two words for you. Threesome.

speaker: s02e08c06u007
line: Ok, all right, look. Let's get logical about this, ok? We'll make a list. Rachel and Julie, pros and cons. Oh. We'll put their names in bold, with different fonts, and I can use different colors for each column.

speaker: s02e08c06u008
line: Can't we just use a pen?

speaker: s02e08c06u009
line: No, Amish boy.

speaker: s02e08c06u010
line: Ok, let's start with the cons, 'cause they're more fun. All right, Rachel first.

speaker: s02e08c06u011
line: I don't know. I mean, all right, I guess you can say she's a little spoiled sometimes.

speaker: s02e08c06u012
line: You could say that.

speaker: s02e08c06u013
line: And I guess, you know, sometimes, she's a little ditzy, you know. And I've seen her be a little too into her looks. Oh, and Julie and I, we have a lot in common 'cause we're both paleontologists, but Rachel's just a waitress.

speaker: s02e08c06u014
line: Waitress. Got it. You guys wanna play Doom? Or we could keep doing this. What else?

speaker: s02e08c06u015
line: I don't know.

speaker: s02e08c06u016
line: Oh, her ankles are a little chubby.

speaker: s02e08c06u017
line: Ok, let's do Julie. What's wrong with her?

speaker: s02e08c06u018
line: She's not Rachel.

speaker: s02e08c07u002
line: Ok, this is pumpkin pie with mockolate cookie crumb crust. This is mockolate cranberry cake, and these are mockolate chip cookies. Just like the Indians served.

speaker: s02e08c07u003
line: Oh my god.

speaker: s02e08c07u004
line: Oh my god good?

speaker: s02e08c07u005
line: Oh my god, I can't believe you let me put this in my mouth.

speaker: s02e08c07u006
line: Oh, oh sweet Lord! This is what evil must taste like!

speaker: s02e08c09u002
line: My diary! My diary, that's brilliant. I should have told her it was my diary, she never would have made me read her my diary.

speaker: s02e08c09u003
line: You know, that's true. You'd be a great person to have around the day after an emergency.

speaker: s02e08c09u004
line: I... I cannot believe Ross even made this list. What a dinkus.

speaker: s02e08c09u005
line: Hey, cut him some slack. It was Chandler's idea.

speaker: s02e08c09u006
line: What?

speaker: s02e08c09u007
line: What?

speaker: s02e08c09u008
line: Oh good, I was hoping that would come up.

speaker: s02e08c09u009
line: This was your idea?

speaker: s02e08c09u010
line: What were you thinking?

speaker: s02e08c09u011
line: All right, let's get some perspective here, ok? These things, they happen for a reason.

speaker: s02e08c09u012
line: Yeah. You!

speaker: s02e08c09u013
line: All right, Pheebs, back me up here, ok? You believe in that karma crap, don't you?

speaker: s02e08c09u014
line: Yeah, by the way, good luck in your next life as a dung beetle.

speaker: s02e08c10u002
line: Rach! Whoops! Rach, hey, open up, please!

speaker: s02e08c10u003
line: When somebody does not buzz you in, Ross, that means go away. That doesn't mean please climb up the fire escape.

speaker: s02e08c10u004
line: I just wanna read something. It's your pro list.

speaker: s02e08c10u005
line: Not interested.

speaker: s02e08c10u006
line: Ok, ok, number one: The way you cry at game shows. Number two: how much you love your friends. Number three: the way you play with your hair when you're nervous. Number four: how brave you are for starting your life over. Number five: how great you are with Ben.

speaker: s02e08c10u007
line: Number six: the way you smell.

speaker: s02e08c10u008
line: Hey, Ross! What are you doin'?

speaker: s02e08c10u009
line: Hey, Joey. You wanna open the window?

speaker: s02e08c10u010
line: Oh, yeah, I do.

speaker: s02e08c10u011
line: What are you doing out there?

speaker: s02e08c10u012
line: I am, uh, I am...

speaker: s02e08c10u013
line: Oh, you must be freezing. You know what you need? How about a nice steaming cup of hot Mockolate?

speaker: s02e08c10u014
line: Rach, come on, open up. Rach, come on, come on, Rach. You got to give me another chance.

speaker: s02e08c10u015
line: No.

speaker: s02e08c10u016
line: No?

speaker: s02e08c10u017
line: That's what I said.

speaker: s02e08c10u018
line: Look, maybe we should go?

speaker: s02e08c10u019
line: No, you guys, you really don't have to go, we're done talking.

speaker: s02e08c10u020
line: Rach, come on, look, I know how you must feel.

speaker: s02e08c10u021
line: No, you don't, Ross. Imagine the worst things you think about yourself. Now, how would you feel if the one person that you trusted the most in the world not only thinks them too, but actually uses them as reasons not to be with you.

speaker: s02e08c10u022
line: No, but, but I wanna be with you in spite of all those things.

speaker: s02e08c10u023
line: Oh, well, that's, that's mighty big of you, Ross. I said don't go!

speaker: s02e08c10u024
line: You know what? You know what? If, things were the other way around, there's nothing you could put on a list that would ever make me not want to be with you.

speaker: s02e08c10u025
line: Well, then, I guess that's the difference between us. See, I'd never make a list.

speaker: s02e08c10u026
line: I never know how long you're supposed to wait in this type of a situation before you can talk again, you know? Maybe a little longer.

line: Now, in some of these recipes, the quantities may seem just a little unusual, uh, like these coconut mockolate holiday nut bars. I've indicated four cups of coconut, and four cups of crushed nut, and only, uh, one tablespoon of mockolate.

line: Doesn't matter.

line: What?

line: Our FDA approval didn't come through. Something about laboratory rats.

line: Oh, gosh, I'm sorry.

line: Yeah, well, anyhoo, here is your check. Thank you for all the trouble you went through. Um, listen, you didn't eat a lot of it while you were cooking, did you?

line: Well, uh, I ate some.
